name: Introduction to Loud Noises
description: A foundational course in making sound travel unreasonably far. Students will learn basic techniques in breath control, instrument tuning, and how to clear a room in under five seconds.

name: Advanced Squeezing Techniques
description: Explores the delicate art of applying precise pressure to inflatable livestock. Emphasis on rhythm, endurance, and not popping the bag mid-solo.

name: Celtic Sound Design Elective
description: Students choose from a selection of sound design courses involving improvised sound effects, distortion, and the mystical power of reverb in stone castles.

name: Bagpipe Maintenance and Emergency Repairs
description: Covers the anatomy of the bagpipe, how to soothe an angry reed, and what to do when your bagpipe starts playing jazz unprompted.

name: Marching in Plaid: Movement for Musicians
description: Learn to march with swagger while wearing a kilt and playing the pipes. Includes bagpipe yoga and tactical pivoting for parades and spontaneous duels.

name: Experimental Bagpipe Elective
description: Explore cross-disciplinary experiments such as bagpipe dubstep, underwater piping, and duets with angry geese.
